com.b2international.snowowl.datastore.oplock

Interface IOperationLockManager<C extends Serializable>

  • Type Parameters:
    C - the lock context type (must implement Serializable)
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IDatastoreOperationLockManager
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractOperationLockManager, DatastoreOperationLockManager, ReentrantOperationLockManager

    public interface IOperationLockManager<C extends Serializable>
    Represents an exclusive lock manager that allows contexts of arbitrary type to lock potentially nested IOperationLockTargets. The first context to acquire a lock for a certain target may add multiple following locks to the same or any included target, while all lock requests will be refused if another context has already acquired the lock for a target overlapping with the requested target.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static long IMMEDIATE
      Special timeout value indicating that the specified lock attempt should immediately throw OperationLockException if the requested locks can not be acquired.
      static long NO_TIMEOUT
      Special timeout value indicating that the specified lock attempt should never throw a OperationLockException because of an exceeded time limit.

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void lock(C context, long timeoutMillis, IOperationLockTarget firstTarget, IOperationLockTarget... restTargets)
      Locks one or more targets for the specified lock context.

      Locks one or more targets for the specified lock context.
      void unlock(C context, IOperationLockTarget firstTarget, IOperationLockTarget... restTargets)
      Unlocks one or more targets with the specified lock context.
      void unlock(C context, Iterable<? extends IOperationLockTarget> targets)
      Unlocks one or more targets with the specified lock context.

      • NO_TIMEOUT

        static final long NO_TIMEOUT
        Special timeout value indicating that the specified lock attempt should never throw a OperationLockException because of an exceeded time limit.
        See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • lock

        void lock(C context,
          long timeoutMillis,
          IOperationLockTarget firstTarget,
          IOperationLockTarget... restTargets)
   throws OperationLockException,
          InterruptedException
        Locks one or more targets for the specified lock context.
        Parameters:
        context - the lock context (may not be null)
        timeoutMillis - the maximum allowed time in milliseconds in which this call may block (must be NO_TIMEOUT, zero or positive)
        firstTarget - the first (or only) target to lock (may not be null)
        restTargets - subsequent targets to lock (may not be null; individual elements may not be null)
        Throws:
        OperationLockException - when one or more locks for the given targets can not be acquired for some reason
        InterruptedException - if waiting for the requested locks to be acquired is interrupted

      • lock

        void lock(C context,
          long timeoutMillis,
          Iterable<? extends IOperationLockTarget> targets)
   throws OperationLockException,
          InterruptedException
        Locks one or more targets for the specified lock context.
        Parameters:
        context - the lock context (may not be null)
        timeoutMillis - the maximum allowed time in milliseconds in which this call may block (must be NO_TIMEOUT, zero or positive)
        targets - the targets to lock (may not be null; can be empty)
        Throws:
        OperationLockException - when one or more locks for the given targets can not be acquired for some reason
        InterruptedException - if waiting for the requested locks to be acquired is interrupted

      • unlock

        void unlock(C context,
            IOperationLockTarget firstTarget,
            IOperationLockTarget... restTargets)
     throws OperationLockException
        Unlocks one or more targets with the specified lock context.
        Parameters:
        context - the lock context (may not be null)
        firstTarget - the first (or only) target to unlock (may not be null)
        restTargets - subsequent targets to unlock (may not be null; individual elements may not be null)
        Throws:
        OperationLockException - when one or more locks for the given targets could not be released for some reason

      • unlock

        void unlock(C context,
            Iterable<? extends IOperationLockTarget> targets)
     throws OperationLockException
        Unlocks one or more targets with the specified lock context.
        Parameters:
        context - the lock context (may not be null)
        targets - the targets to unlock (may not be null; can be empty)
        Throws:
        OperationLockException - when one or more locks for the given targets could not be released for some reason
